author: 0xalizk
content:
I have two questions 
(1) what minimum hardware spec would you recommend to run an archive node in terms of cores, RAM, SSD and 
(2) is there a reason to run a full node besides an archive node (would some queries be faster?)?

author: vorot93
content:
<@!636212126939217941>
1) turbo-geth archive node consumes between 500 and 750 GB on SSD, depending on pruning settings for optional data (e.g. receipts).
2) The difference is that archive node keeps *all* historical states on disk, while non-archive node deletes old states after a period of time. If you already maintain an archive node, there is no sense in keeping a pruned node in addition.
